description.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Who am I? Heh, I'm the boss around here, you can call me... Pitch-Dark Hook the Great! Don't underestimate her, she's the boss of The Moles adventure squad! If you stand out on your adventure, maybe Pitch-Dark Hook the Great will invite you to join The Moles. You'll have to find out for yourself what kind of experience that would be~","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

traces.desc: Hook restores HP equal to 5% of her Max HP whenever her Talent is triggered.
traces.name: Innocence

traces.desc: The chance to resist Crowd Control Debuffs increases by 35%.
traces.name: Naivete

traces.desc: When using her Ultimate, Hook has her action Advanced Forward by 20% and Hook additionally regenerates 5 Energy.
traces.name: Playing With Fire

review.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Hook is a mostly single-target focused damage dealer with some occasional Blast AoE thrown in. She is focused on inflicting Burn on enemies and then dealing increased damage against them, while also recovering some HP for herself and even regenerating some extra Energy. Her infrequent AoE results in her being more of an honorary Hunt unit, rather than a fully fledged Destruction character.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"We’ve got characters like Qingque that are ‘Erudition’ in point size 50 inverted commas, and then we’ve got Hook who is ‘Destruction question mark?’ and doesn’t really seem to be doing Destruction things as well as she probably should do. Even still, she’s a decent damage dealer and a relatively accessible source of Fire DMG.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Hook’s Skill deals up to 240% ATK to a single enemy and has a 100% base chance to Burn them for 2 turns, with the Burn dealing 65% ATK at the start of each turn. This Skill has an Enhanced version after using her Ultimate that deals up to 280% ATK to a single enemy and 80% ATK to adjacent foes, with the same Burn chance and damage.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Her Ultimate deals up to 400% ATK to a single enemy and Enhances her next Skill. That’s it, that’s all it does. Would have been nice for it to be AoE but at least it has a good damage multiplier. It also has an average Energy cost of 120 meaning it’s up more than you’d think, especially when factoring in Hook’s Talent. Hook’s Talent will deal additional Fire DMG of up to 100% ATK when Hook attacks a target afflicted with Burn, and will also regenerate 5 extra Energy. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"With this, it’s plain to see that Hook is really not that complicated of a character, perhaps even to her detriment in some regards. What I mean by this is that there’s nothing to really optimise or play around with. Our collective galaxybrains are mostly useless here since Hook’s kit really is just this simple. Her upsides and downsides are as presented, and that’s a little unfortunate since it results in her potential being really quite low by comparison to other characters.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"There can be no new support character that is beneficial to Hook’s performance without also ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"italic"}],"value":"always","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" being better for ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"italic"}],"value":"other ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"damage dealers. She’s a competent dps, but with her being quote unquote ‘Destruction’ and more like a Hunt character, she naturally struggles in many of the scenarios we see in the endgame these days. If there’s ever a Fire-weak Boss that needs to be pounded into the ground, then Pitch Dark Hook the Great will undoubtedly have a good time against them — provided they don’t summon reinforcements all the time. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Hook’s Bonus Ability Traces definitely help out quite a bit with her performance but are really equally as boring as the rest of her kit. A2 restores 5% Max HP to Hook whenever her Talent is triggered, A4 increases the chance to resist Crowd Control debuffs by 35%, and A6 will Action Advance Hook by 20% when using her Ultimate, and additionally restore an extra 5 Energy.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"It’s a lot of extra Energy coming Hook’s way for just playing the game as you normally would, and it definitely contributes a fair bit to even more frequent Ultimates, thus reducing the downtime on her only source of AoE in her Enhanced Skill. Especially if you include teammates like Tingyun or Huohuo with Hook, you can end up getting extraordinarily frequent Ultimates that are dealing 500% ATK with her Talent included. It’s definitely nothing to scoff at, and Hook’s base stats are also surprisingly good.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"With Eidolons, Hook’s performance actually goes up a fair bit. E1 grants a 20% DMG bonus to her Enhanced Skill, and E2 extends the duration of her Skill’s Burn by 1 turn. This leads to greatly increased consistency especially since you’re not likely to be building for Effect Hit Rate on purpose on Hook. E4 continues the trend by having a 100% base chance to burn adjacent enemies whenever her Talent is triggered, and finally E6 caps things off with a 20% DMG bonus against Burned enemies.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"She’s definitely one of the forgotten characters of this game, and it’s a bit unfortunate because she’s really not bad at all. It’s just that there are plenty of characters that are ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"italic"}],"value":"better","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":". If Hook was given out for free to players like Qingque or more recently Lynx, I think people would be much more likely to actually use her, especially since there aren’t really many strong accessible Fire units, even more so early on. What, you’re gonna bring Fire Trailblazer as your solo damage option to the endgame? Yeah, good luck with that, I literally tried that already buddy. I’ll give you one guess as to how it turned out.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"If you’re lacking a Fire option but are sitting by an unlevelled Hook with potentially even E6, I may even recommend using her until you get something better. You may even be pleasantly surprised by her performance.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

pros.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Great single-target damage output, ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Lots of free Energy from her kit, ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Faster than you may expect due to Action Advance from A6, ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"High single-target Toughness damage.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

cons.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Not really a Destruction unit in any way, more like a Hunt with occasional AoE, ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Reliant on Burn to land for maximum power, ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Can’t really be optimised beyond her apparent strength, ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"More and better generalist characters exist.","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"\n\n","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

conesNew.notes: Assumes you maintain the full 4 attack stacks (64% ATK) at all times and maintain the weakness break bonus 50% of the time. In fights where this is not the case for the majority of the duration its damage will be lower.

On the Fall of An Aeon with 0% uptime is calculated assuming you maintain the full 4 attack stacks (64% ATK) at all times and the weakness break bonus is never active - which is the case in most fights the enemy is not vulnerable to the wearer of the Cone.
Assumes to have 100% uptime of its on-kill buff at all times. In fights where this is not the case for the majority of the duration, its damage will be lower.
Assumes to have 100% uptime of all 3 components of its buff requiring a Basic ATK, Skill and Ultimate. In fights where this is not the case for the majority of the duration its damage will be lower.
Assumes enemy always has a Bleed or Rurn applied to them at all times for the damage bonus. In fights where this is not the case for the majority of the duration its damage will be lower.
Assumes to have 100% uptime of 2 components of its buff requiring two of Basic ATK, Skill and Ultimate. In fights where this is not the case for the majority of the duration its damage will be lower.

Assumes to only have its base 40% damage increase active as enemies almost always have higher lower HP than your units. In fights where this is not the case and your units end up at lower HP than the enemy its performance will increase.
Assumes to have 0% uptime of its on-kill buff.

buildData.comments: This is your typical DPS build that focuses on the holy trifecta - ATK, Crit Rate, and Crit DMG. For every 1% of Crit try to have 2% of Crit DMG.
buildData.substats: SPD (breakpoint) > CRIT RATE = CRIT DMG > ATK%
buildData.name: General DPS
